data.question: What is the total power output of a source with intensity 0.050 W/m2 at a distance of 3.0m from the source?

Which of the following statements are correct of nuclear fission? During the process 
I. energy is released 
II. More neutrons are released than those that cause fission 
III. Small nuclei merge into large nuclei 
IV. There is a loss on mass

A mass of 0.5kg is attached to one end of a helical spring and produces an extension of 2.5cm. The mass now set into vertically oscillation of amplitude 10mm. The period of oscillation is: (g = 10m/s2)
Which of the following about electrolysis is false?

option.a: liquid that conduct electricity and are split up chemically by the current are electrolyzed
option.b: the current into the electrolyte by the anode
option.c: the current is taken away from the electrolyte by the cathode
option.d: the container which holds the electrolyte and the electrode is the voltmeter

data.question: In the force of gravity on an object of mass m, the gravitational field strength, g, is given by the following equation.
An automobile is traveling at 60km/hr. calculate the angular velocity of the 0.35m radius wheels.
Which of the following phenomena cannot be explained by the molecular theory of matter?
A 0.040kg string 0.80m long is stretched and vibrated in a fundamental mode with a frequency of 40Hz. What is the speed (of propagation) of the wave and tension in the string?

An air bubble at the bottom of a lake has a volume of 20cm3, pressure of 4.9Pa, and temperature 4oc the bubble rises to the surface where the temperature is 20oc and the pressure 1.0Pa. Find the volume as the bubble reaches the surface. (take 1 atm = 1.0 x 105 N/m2)
Which of the following statements is not true?

option.a: electric field intensity is force per unit charge.
option.c: the S.I unit of electric field strength is N/C
option.d: electric field intensity is equal to the potential gradient

data.question: A gas at constant pressure of 4.0 x 105 Pa is cooled so that its volume decreases from 1.6m3 to 1.2m3. What work is performed by the gas?
The acceleration due to gravity

option.c: increases with increase in the square of the altitude
option.d: is not affected by the altitude

data.question: When three coplanar non-parallel forces are in equilibrium i. they can be represented in magnitude and direction by the three sides of a triangle taken in order ii. The lines of action meet at a point iii. The magnitude of any one force equals the magnitude of the other two forces iv. Any one force is the equivalent of the other two. Which of the following statements above are correct?
If 21g of alcohol of density 0.7gcm-3 is mixed with 10g of water, what would be the density of the resulting mixture?
Which of the following is not true about the properties of x-rays?

option.a: they are not deflected by magnetic or electric field
option.b: they ionized a gas making it a conductor

data.question: The most likely measurement of length of an object using a venier caliper is:
For  a particle having an x co-ordinate that varies in time according to the express ion x = 4t -2t2 The instantaneous velocity for of the particle at t = 2.5s is:
Which of the following statements is not true about a body performing simple harmonic motion?

option.a: the linear speed is the product of the angular speed and the radius or amplitude
option.b: the linear acceleration is the product of the square of the angular speed and the displacement
option.c: frequency is the number of complete revolution per second made by a vibrating body
option.d: the S.I unit of amplitude is Hertz (Hz)

data.question: A transformer is connected to a 240 V supply. The primary coil has 40 turns, and the secondary is found to be 960V. What is the ratio of the number of turns of the primary coil to the number of turns of the secondary coil?

A boat is passing under a bridge. The deck of the boat is 15m below the bridge. A small package is to be dropped from the bridge onto the deck of the boat is 25m from just below the drop point. What speed is necessary to have the package land in the boat? (g= 9.8ms-2)
A long-jumper leaves the ground at an angle of 20o above the horizontal and at speed of 11m/s. How far does it jumps in the horizontal direction?
The superposition of two or more waves to produce a maximum or zero effect at a point is known as:
Highly polished silvery  surfaces are:

option.a: poor absorbers but good emitter of radiation
option.b: good absorbers and good emitters of radiation
option.c: poor emitters but good reflectors of radiation
option.d: poor emitters and poor reflectors of radiation

data.question: A 0.60kg rubber stopper is whirled in a horizontal circle of 0.80m radius at a rate of 3.0 revolutions per second. What is the tension in the string?
Which of the following is not true about an object that is projected upwards at angle θ?

option.a: the velocity is maximum at the maximum height
option.b: the acceleration along the horizontal direction is zero
option.c: the maximum range (Rmax) for an object moving with speed u is given by u2/g
option.d: the time it takes to get the maximum height is equal to the time it takes to come back to the point of projection
